basics.name: Abdelrahman Mohamed Roshdy Hamouda
basics.summary: Experienced DevOps Engineer with a strong background in cloud platforms like AWS and GCP, CI/CD automation, and infrastructure as code. Proven track record of optimizing deployment pipelines, enhancing system observability, and implementing robust security practices. Adept at collaborating with cross-functional teams to deliver scalable and reliable solutions.

work.summary: Collaborated on the development of an AI platform, improved CI/CD pipelines, and implemented observability solutions with OpenTelemetry.
highlights: Collaborated on a scalable AI platform development with Kubernetes, ArgoCD, and self-hosted GitLab.
Enhanced CI/CD pipelines to enable smoother releases and minimal downtime.
Implemented observability solutions with OpenTelemetry, Prometheus, Grafana, and Loki.

work.name: Vodafone International Services (VOIS)
work.summary: Supported LLM model deployment, cloud infrastructure provisioning, and DevSecOps practices.
highlights: Collaborated with Google Cloud Team to develop audit solutions for LLM requests.
Supported LLM model deployment using GCP Vertex AI and Azure OpenAI services.
Implemented DevSecOps practices with Trivy, improving security compliance to 98%.

work.name: Brain
work.summary: Implemented CI/CD pipelines, API monitoring, and N8N workflow automation.
highlights: Designed and managed cloud infrastructure with Terraform.
Developed CI/CD pipelines for seamless testing and deployment.
Set up API monitoring with Prometheus and Grafana to ensure optimal performance.

courses: Graduation project: Smart Home Mirror with Face ID, Touchscreen, Voice Control, and IoT features.

certificates.name: Google Cloud Professional Cloud Architect Certification
Google Cloud Certified Professional Cloud DevOps Engineer
CCNA: Enterprise Introduction to Networking, Security, and Automation

projects.name: Quantum Computing
projects.summary: Quantum computing is the use of quantum-mechanical phenomena such as superposition and entanglement to perform computation. Computers that perform quantum computations are known as quantum computers.
